intro: Nissolia ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty nissolia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, reddish-brown stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Nissolia ferruginea is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas.
